explanations.machine learning: The paper employs binary classification algorithms like Ada Boost and support vector machines, which are part of machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper uses binary classification algorithms, which are a type of supervised learning, to model overreaction and improve trading strategies.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on binary classification algorithms to model financial time-series patterns and improve trading strategies.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper explicitly mentions the use of support vector machines (SVM) as one of the binary classification algorithms.
explanations.SVM: This is an abbreviation for support vector machine, which is used in the paper.
explanations.feature representation: The paper discusses three different feature extraction methods to represent learning samples in a high-dimensional financial time-series feature space.
